name: places/ChIJ6cJPLldYwokR6xFh-EaMBfk
adrFormatAddress: 752 9th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA

originalText.text: I recently had a fantastic experience with Rafik. I was devastated when the heels of my favorite pair of shoes broke, and I didn’t know who to come to. Rafik was recommended to me, and thanks to his staffs skills and craftsmanship they were restored to perfection. The repair exceeded my expectations. Not only did they expertly fix the broken heels, but the attention to detail was remarkable. It's as if my shoes came back to life—they looked brand new!! I recommend him to everyone, he will help you and talk you through anything you need help fixing.

originalText.text: Exceptional work and uncomparable service define this hidden gem of a shoe repair shop. Every worn sole and scuffed heel I’ve had was transformed thanks to Rafik and his staff. From the detailing, to the use of high-quality materials, the team always goes above and beyond. Rafik demonstrates a genuine passion for his work, ensuring not only the repair but such amazing customer service. The service was prompt, and the prices were extremely reasonable for the superb quality of work. This establishment goes beyond mere repair; it's a haven for those who value good customer service. All my friends and family come here- and it’s for a reason! We appreciate your excellent business!

originalText.text: Total incompetence. Asked for 2 expensive belts to be shortened - SIMPLE request. Instead of doing it the proper way, they just cut off the ends with a knife. Then went back to insert belt holes and they totally butchered the belt. Won’t be back

text.text: Total incompetence. Asked for 2 expensive belts to be shortened - SIMPLE request. Instead of doing it the proper way, they just cut off the ends with a knife. Then went back to insert belt holes and they totally butchered the belt. Won’t be back

originalText.text: Came to repair only one piece of shoe, the owner made me repair two by torn open the other good one, I asked him to match the sole height of the other one, he made the new one much higher, in this case I had to get the two replaced… such a hustle, In fact, this was not the only time, seems like he like to make to people replace and get more fixed than necessary, so that he could charge more… I think overall the shoe was done ok, but I don’t like how I was treated here.

text.text: Came to repair only one piece of shoe, the owner made me repair two by torn open the other good one, I asked him to match the sole height of the other one, he made the new one much higher, in this case I had to get the two replaced… such a hustle, In fact, this was not the only time, seems like he like to make to people replace and get more fixed than necessary, so that he could charge more… I think overall the shoe was done ok, but I don’t like how I was treated here.

originalText.text:
Rafik is a godsend! His shop, tucked neatly behind a neighborhood barbershop, is one of the only shoe repair places still open in 2020. It took going to six closed stores to finally stumble across his store - and boy am I glad that I did!

Rafik has helped me with shortening a belt (and adding holes) and also did a great job with widening my mother's evening shoes. Rafik guarantees his work and even offered to widen them further should she need it. He's a true gentleman, as are the barbers who attended me once when he had stepped away. Excellent craftsmanship, friendly demeanor, very fair prices, and work done in a quick and timely manner. If only more businesses would respect their craft and treat their customers this way! 5 stars and highly recommended! A true neighborhood gem! Will be back soon to change the battery in my watch and try out the barber services as well!
